Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ctenidin-3 (Gly-rich; antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Most similar (46.4%) tospider Acanthoscurrin 2AP02207.Activity: Active primarily against E. coli (MIC 2-5 uM) evaluated using a mixture of peptides. This is a bacteriostatic effect. The growth of S. aureus was inhibited (MIC >10 uM) and no inhibition was observed against C-albicans up to 5 uM.Host expression: constitutively expressed in hemocytes.   Provided by Xiuqing Wang. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Baumann T, Kämpfer U, Schürch S, Schaller J, Largiadèr C, Nentwig W, Kuhn-Nentwig L.2010
Literature Information.Title: Ctenidins: antimicrobial glycine-rich peptides from the hemocytes of the spider Cupiennius salei
